title: विधि और न्याय मंत्रालय, भारत सरकार | विभाग ज्ञान पोर्टल
main_topics: नियुक्ति, इस्तीफा और निष्कासन और उनके सेवा मामले शामिल हैं।

विभाग न्यायपालिका के लिए बुनियादी सुविधाओं के विकास, संवेदनशील प्रकृति के मामलों के त्वरित विचारण और निपटान के लिए विशेष न्यायालयों की स्थापना (बलात्कार और पॉक्सो अधिनियम के मामलों के लिए फास्ट ट्रैक स्पेशल कोर्ट)

देश भर के विभिन्न न्यायालयों का कम्प्यूटरीकरण पर ई-कोर्ट परियोजना, गरीबों को कानूनी सहायता और न्याय तक पहुंच, देश के न्यायिक अधिकारियों को प्रशिक्षण प्रदान करने के लिए राष्ट्रीय न्यायिक अकादमी को वित्तीय सहायता के लिए महत्वपूर्ण योजनाओं को लागू करता है।
summary: विधि और न्याय मंत्रालय द्वारा न्याय प्रदान करना, संवेदनशील मामलों का त्वरित विचारण, गरीबों की कानूनी सहायता, और न्यायिक अधिकारियों को प्रशिक्षित करने के लिए राष्ट्रीय न्यायिक अकादमी को वित्तीय सहायता।

title: First National Judicial Pay Commission
summary: This webpage provides information about the First National Judicial Pay Commission, established in March 1996 to examine service conditions and salary structure of judicial officers. The commission submitted its report to the government and Supreme Court of India in 1999, which was accepted and implemented by the Department of Justice.

title: Second National Judicial Pay Commission | Department of Justice | India
summary: The web page is about the Second National Judicial Pay Commission, which was set up by the Government of India to review the pay scales, emoluments and service conditions of judicial officers in subordinate judiciary. The commission's report has been submitted to the Supreme Court of India and state governments, and its recommendations are being considered.

title: Pecuniary Jurisdiction of Delhi District Courts | Department of Justice | India
main_topics: Pecuniary Jurisdiction of Delhi District Courts
Government of National Capital Territory of Delhi
summary: The page provides information on the pecuniary jurisdiction of Delhi District Courts. The government had received a request to enhance the original pecuniary jurisdiction from Rs. 20 lakh to Rs. 2 crore, which was examined and a Bill was introduced in Parliament. The amendment aims to lessen the burden on the High Court and improve the disposal of cases in subordinate courts.

title: Use of Hindi and regional languages | Department of Justice | India
main_topics: Use of Hindi and regional languages
summary: The page discusses the use of Hindi and regional languages in the Department of Justice, India. It explains Article 348(1) of the Constitution of India and the Official Language Act, 1963, which govern the language used in court proceedings. The page also mentions the recommendations of the 18th Law Commission of India and the decisions of the Chief Justice of India regarding the use of Hindi in High Court proceedings.

title: Redressal of Public Grievances | Department of Justice | India
summary: The Department of Justice receives a large number of citizen grievances through various channels and deals with grievances related to appointment of judges, legal assistance, e-Courts, and judicial reforms. Detailed guidelines for disposal of grievances have been uploaded on the website.

title: Guidelines of Grievances | Department of Justice | India
summary: The Department of Justice provides guidelines on grievances, stating that the judiciary is an independent organ of the State and the Government does not interfere in its functioning. Grievances against judicial orders or judgments cannot be taken up by the government, but can be inquired into by the concerned High Court or Supreme Court. Detailed guidelines are available on the Department's website.

title: Fast Track Special Courts (FTSCs) | Department of Justice | India
summary: The Department of Justice has implemented a Centrally Sponsored Scheme to set up Fast Track Special Courts (FTSCs) across the nation for expeditious trial relating to sexual offences. As on May 2024, 755 FTSCs including 410 exclusive POCSO Courts are functional in 30 States / UTs which have disposed of more than 2,53,000 pending cases.

title: Special Courts for MP/MLA | Department of Justice | India
summary: This webpage provides information about Special Courts for MP/MLA, which were established by the Union Government in 2017 to expedite trials of criminal cases involving MPs and MLAs. The courts are monitored by the Hon'ble Supreme Court of India, and their performance is tracked.

title: National Judicial Academy
summary: The National Judicial Academy, established in 1993, is an independent society fully funded by the Government of India. The academy's mandate is to organize trainings for judges and court administration staff. From 2017 to 2024, NJA conducted a total of 455 academic programs with over 16,400 participants from various jurisdictions, including foreign countries such as Bangladesh, Bhutan, Myanmar, and Maldives.

title: Vision Document | Department of Justice | India
main_topics: National Mission for Justice Delivery and Legal Reforms
summary: The Vision Document outlines the Department of Justice's National Mission for Justice Delivery and Legal Reforms, which aims to reduce delays and arrears in the system, enhance accountability through structural changes, and set performance standards and capacities. The document also covers various initiatives and programs under this mission, including computerization, virtual courts, tele-law, nyaya bandhu, and right to information.

title: Advisory Council | Department of Justice | India
main_topics: National Mission for Justice Delivery & Legal Reforms
summary: The Department of Justice, Ministry of Law and Justice, Government of India, provides information on its Advisory Council, National Mission for Justice Delivery & Legal Reforms, PFMS, eCourts MMP, and other initiatives. The page also provides details on various projects, schemes, and programs related to justice delivery and legal reforms.

title: Scheme for Action Research and Studies on Judicial Reforms
summary: The page describes the Scheme for Action Research and Studies on Judicial Reforms, a project sanctioned by the Department of Justice. The scheme aims to improve the justice delivery system through research projects. It outlines the project sanctioning committee, implementation details, and registration process for NGOs/VOS/registered companies. Additionally, it lists ongoing projects related to judicial reforms.

main_topics: Department of Justice, Ministry of Law & Justice, Government of India
summary: The eCourts Phase III is a Central Sector Scheme aimed at digitizing court records, creating a unified technology platform for the judiciary, and promoting ease of justice through accessibility, affordability, reliability, predictability, and transparency.

title: Computerization and WAN connectivity | Department of Justice | India
summary: The Department of Justice, Ministry of Law and Justice, Government of India has successfully connected 99.5% of all District and Subordinate court complexes across the country using various technologies like OFC, RF, VSAT, with a bandwidth speed of 10 Mbps to 100 Mbps. This WAN connectivity has enabled better Video Conferencing facilities and improved access to justice, especially during the COVID-19 scenario.

title: CIS and COVID Management Software Patch | Department of Justice | India
summary: The Department of Justice, Ministry of Law and Justice, Government of India, has developed a software patch to manage court cases during the COVID-19 pandemic. The patch allows for smart scheduling of cases, reducing overcrowding in court premises and accommodating lawyer convenience. It is based on customized Free and Open-Source Software (FOSS) developed by NIC.

title: The National Judicial Data Grid (NJDG) | Department of Justice | India
summary: The National Judicial Data Grid (NJDG) is an online platform under the eCourts Project, providing data on judicial proceedings and decisions of all computerized district and subordinate courts in India. It offers case status information for over 26 crore cases and more than 26.91 crore orders/judgments. The NJDG works as a monitoring tool to identify, manage & reduce pendency of cases, facilitating better court performance and systemic bottleneck monitoring.

title: Virtual Courts | Department of Justice | India
summary: The Department of Justice, Ministry of Law and Justice, GOI has introduced a novel concept of virtual courts to deal with petty traffic offence cases. The virtual court can be managed by a virtual judge whose jurisdiction can be extended to the entire state, working hours may be 24X7. As on 30.06.2024, there are 28 such courts in 21 States / UTs handling over 5.26 crore cases and realizing online fine of more than Rs. 579.40 crores.

title: Video Conferencing | Department of Justice | India
main_topics: High Courts and District Courts Adoption
summary: The Department of Justice, India, has implemented video conferencing as the mainstay of courts during the COVID lockdown period. The Supreme Court, High Courts, and District Courts have adopted video conferencing rules, with a uniform platform being developed. Mobile e-courts vans have been introduced in remote areas to facilitate speedy disposal of cases.

title: Live Streaming | Department of Justice | India
summary: The Department of Justice, Ministry of Law and Justice, Government of India provides live streaming of video conferencing proceedings in various High Courts and the Supreme Court of India. The page also features information on eCourts MMP, National Judicial Data Grid (NJDG), Virtual Courts, eFiling, Tele Law, and other initiatives.

title: eFiling | Department of Justice | India
summary: The eFiling system allows lawyers and litigants to electronically file legal papers from anywhere, reducing the need for physical presence in court. The new version of the e-filing portal provides features such as video recording of oath, indexing of documents, and a user-friendly dashboard. A total of 25 High Courts have adopted the model rules of e-Filing, and instructions have been issued to use e filing in all government litigation by January 2022.

title: e-Payments | Department of Justice | India
summary: The e-Payments page provides information on electronic payment of court fees, fines, and penalties in the Indian judicial system. It explains how to enable e-payments through various electronic payment processes and lists the High Courts that have implemented e-payments.

title: eSewa Kendra | Department of Justice | India
summary: The Department of Justice, Ministry of Law and Justice, Government of India has launched eSewa Kendras to provide electronic filing services to lawyers and litigants. As on June 30, 2024, 1072 eSewa Kendras have been made functional in District Courts under 25 High Courts. The eSewa Kendras aim to bridge the digital divide and facilitate access to online e-Courts services.

title: eCourt Services | Department of Justice | India
summary: The Department of Justice, Ministry of Law and Justice, Government of India provides various e-court services such as online case status, cause lists, judgements, electronic case management tools, mobile apps for lawyers and judges, and more. The website also provides information on the administration of justice, appointment of judges, redressal of public grievances, and other related topics.

summary: The Judgment Search Portal is a website launched by the Department of Justice, India to provide easy access to judgments and final orders of High Courts. The portal features a search engine that allows users to search for judgments based on various criteria such as case type, case number, year, petitioner/respondent name, judge name, act, section, decision date, and full text search.

title: National Service and Tracking of Electronic Processes (NSTEP) | Department of Justice | India
main_topics: National Service and Tracking of Electronic Processes (NSTEP)
summary: The National Service and Tracking of Electronic Processes (NSTEP) is a technology-enabled process serving system that provides real-time status updates and tracks the geographical coordinates of the process server. It has been implemented in 28 States/ UTs and aims to improve transparency and speed up the delivery of processes.

title: Justice Clock | Department of Justice | India
summary: The page provides information about the Department of Justice in India, including its functions, organization chart, and various schemes such as eCourts, Access to Justice, and Tele Law. The Justice Clock system displays information on court cases, legal aid programs, and access to justice schemes, with 39 functional clocks in 25 High Courts.

title: Secure, Scalable & Sugamya Website as a Service (S3WAAS) | Department of Justice | India
summary: The Department of Justice, Ministry of Law and Justice, Government of India has launched a new website called Secure, Scalable & Sugamya Website as a Service (S3WAAS) which is accessible in 13 regional languages including English and Hindi. The website provides information on various topics such as eCommittee, National Judicial Data Grid, Virtual Courts, eFiling, Tele-Law, Nyaya Bandhu, Legal Literacy, and more.

title: Digitization of Records | Department of Justice | India
summary: The Department of Justice, Ministry of Law and Justice, Government of India has finalized a Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) for the digitization of records. The SOP aims to establish dedicated Judicial Digital Repositories (JDRs) at the High Court level to manage and preserve digital records. As on 14.06.2024, 311.10 Cr. pages have been digitized across High Courts and District Courts.

title: Designing Innovative Solutions for Holistic Access to Justice
summary: The Department of Justice, India has launched a Scheme on Access to Justice titled 'Designing Innovative Solutions for Holistic Access to Justice' (DISHA) to secure justice to the people of India. The scheme aims to widen the outreach of Tele-Law, Pro Bono Legal Services (Nyaya Bandhu), and Legal Literacy and Legal Awareness programmes through technology-driven solutions.

title: Access to Justice for the Marginalized
summary: The National Legal Services Authority (NALSA) provides free legal services, organizes Lok Adalats for amicable settlement of disputes, and conducts legal awareness camps in rural areas to ensure access to justice for marginalized communities.

title: About Hamara Samvidhan Hamara Samman | Department of Justice | India
main_topics: Justice for all (Sabko Nyay - Har Ghar Nyaya)
Pledging for a new India (Nav Bharat Nav Sankalp)
Promoting legal literacy and awareness (Vidhi Jagriti Abhiyan)
National Service and Tracking of Electronic Processes (NSTEP)
summary: The Department of Justice, India has launched a year-long campaign called 'Hamara Samvidhan Hamara Samman' to commemorate the 75th anniversary of India's Republic. The campaign aims to empower citizens with knowledge about their legal rights and responsibilities, promote justice for all, and pledge for a new India. It also highlights various initiatives such as National Judicial Data Grid, Virtual Courts, eFiling, and Access to Justice.

title: Sabko Nyay: Panch Pran Pledge, Nyay Sahayak: Community-based Legal Messengers and Nyay Seva Mela: State-Level Legal Services Fair
main_topics: Nyay Seva Mela: State-Level Legal Services Fair
summary: The Department of Justice, Ministry of Law and Justice, GOI has launched various programs to promote citizen-centric services and raise awareness about welfare schemes. The Panch Pran Pledge is a commitment inspired by the Hon'ble Prime Minister's vision, while Nyay Sahayaks are community-based messengers facilitating door-to-door legal services. The Nyay Seva Mela is a State-level workshop cum fair to deliver citizen-centric services and raise awareness about DoJ initiatives.

title: Nav Bharat Nav Sankalp- Overview
summary: The Nav Bharat Nav Sankalp Campaign is an initiative to raise awareness on the principles of Panch Pran and the Constitution among citizens, especially youth. The campaign consists of four engaging activities: Sankalp Saaksharta (pledge), Quiz-Samvidhan (online quiz), Panch Pran Rangostav (poster competition), and Panch Pran Anubhav (selfie video competition). The expected outcome is increased awareness and participation among citizens on the theme of Panch Pran.

title: Vidhi Jagriti Abhiyan - Overview | Department of Justice | India
summary: The Vidhi Jagriti Abhiyan is a program aimed at fostering legal consciousness among diverse segments of society, empowering citizens with knowledge, and championing justice within our democratic framework. The initiative includes three activities: Gram Vidhi Chetna, Vanchit Varg Sammaan Abhiyaan, and Nari Bhagidaari, which aim to reach out to over 190,000 beneficiaries.

title: Media | Department of Justice | India
summary: The Department of Justice is a ministry responsible for the administration of justice in India. The page provides information on various topics such as administrative setup, acts and rules, appointment of judges, fast track special courts, national judicial academy, e-courts, virtual courts, access to justice, tele law, pro-bono legal services, and legal literacy. It also includes sections for media, awards, recognition, and miscellaneous information.

title: National Event - Overview | Department of Justice | India
summary: The Department of Justice launched a year-long campaign, 'HAMARA SAMVIDHAN HAMARA SAMMAN,' to commemorate India's 75th year as a Republic. The campaign aims to enhance awareness about the Constitution, sensitize citizens on Panch Pran principles, and educate them about their rights, duties, and entitlements.

title: Inauguration of the Campaign “Hamara Samvidhan – Hamara Samman” at International Ambedkar Centre (24th Jan, 2024)
summary: The inauguration of the campaign “Hamara Samvidhan – Hamara Samman” took place on January 24, 2024, at the International Ambedkar Centre.

title: 1st Regional Event - Overview | Department of Justice | India
summary: This page provides an overview of the 1st Regional Event organized by the Department of Justice, which was held on March 9, 2024. The event aimed to commemorate India's 75th year as a Republic and featured the official release of innovations to spearhead legal services at the grassroots. Notable dignitaries addressed the importance of human dignity and the need for technological advancement in India.

title: Hamara Samman, Hamara Samvidhan event at Maharaja Ganga Singh University, Bikaner (9th March, 2024)

summary: The webpage provides an overview of the 2nd Regional Event held on July 16, 2024, at Prayagraj, Uttar Pradesh. The event was attended by over 800 people and featured the felicitation of citizens who won a competition under the Hamara Samvidhan Hamara Samman campaign. title: न्याय बंधु (प्रो-बोनो) पोर्टल
summary: न्याय बंधु (प्रो-बोनो) पोर्टल, राष्ट्रीय विधिक सेवा प्राधिकरण (नालसा) और भारत सरकार के सचिव के प्रभार में विधि और न्याय मंत्रालय के तहत काम करता है।

न्याय विभाग भारत सरकार के एक हिस्सा है और यह भारत सरकार के सबसे पुराने मंत्रालयों में से एक है। न्याय विभाग देश में न्यायिक सुधारों पर कई नीतियों और कार्यक्रमों को तैयार करता है और इस उद्देश्य को आगे बढ़ाने के लिए इसके पूर्ण कार्यपालक शक्तियाँ विशेष रूप से अधिनियमित की गई थी। 01.01.2010 से, न्याय विभाग गृह मंत्रालय का हिस्सा नहीं रहा, बल्कि यह भारत सरकार के सचिव के प्रभार के तहत विधि और न्याय मंत्रालय के अधीन है।

title: पहला राष्ट्रीय न्यायिक वेतन आयोग
summary: केंद्र सरकार ने उच्चतम न्यायालय के निर्देशों के अनुसरण में, मार्च, 1996 में पहला राष्ट्रीय न्यायिक वेतन आयोग (एफएनजेपीसी) स्थापित किया था। आयोग के कामकाज के लिए आवश्यक धन की व्यवस्था न्याय विभाग द्वारा की गई थी। आयोग ने 11.11.1999 को अपनी रिपोर्ट सरकार और भारत के उच्चतम न्यायालय को सौंप दी ।

title: न्याय विभाग

रिपोर्ट की एक-एक प्रति भारत के उच्चतम न्यायालय और राज्य सरकारों को प्रस्तुत की गई है ।
एसएनजेपीसी की सिफारिशें भारत के उच्चतम न्यायालय के विचाराधीन हैं।
summary: दूसरा राष्ट्रीय न्यायिक वेतन आयोग की सिफारिशों पर इस विभाग द्वारा केंद्र शासित प्रदेशों के न्यायिक अधिकारियों के संबंध में व्यय विभाग, वित्त मंत्रालय के परामर्श से विचार किया जाएगा।

title: दिल्ली उच्च न्यायालय (संशोधन) विधेयक, 2015
main_topics: दिल्ली के जिला न्यायालयों की आर्थिक अधिकारिता को बढ़ाने से दिल्ली उच्च न्यायालय का बोझ कम होगा और अधीनस्थ न्यायालयों में मामलों के निपटान में पर्याप्त सुधार होगा।
दिल्ली जिला न्यायालयों की आर्थिक अधिकारिता में वृद्धि से आम जनता को उनके स्थान के आसपास के जिला न्यायालयों तक पहुंचने में सुविधा होगी।
दिल्ली के विभिन्न हिस्सों में जिला न्यायालयों के स्थान के कारण "दरवाजे पर न्याय" प्रदान करने में वादियों के लिए भी सहायक होगा।

दिल्ली उच्च न्यायालय अधिनियम, 1966 में संशोधन की मांग करते हुए राष्ट्रीय राजधानी क्षेत्र दिल्ली से प्राप्त प्रस्ताव की जांच की गई और एक विधेयक अर्थात दिल्ली उच्च न्यायालय (संशोधन) विधेयक, 2015 संसद में पेश किया गया।
summary: राष्ट्रीय राजधानी क्षेत्र दिल्ली के जिला न्यायालयों की आर्थिक सीमा को मौजूदा 20 लाख रुपये से बढ़ाकर 2 करोड़ रुपये करने के लिए दिल्ली उच्च न्यायालय अधिनियम, 1966 में संशोधन की मांग करते हुए राष्ट्रीय राजधानी क्षेत्र दिल्ली से प्राप्त प्रस्ताव की जांच की गई और एक विधेयक अर्थात दिल्ली उच्च न्यायालय (संशोधन) विधेयक, 2015 संसद में पेश किया गया।

title: Nirbhaya Fund (NF)
summary: The Nirbhaya Fund is a scheme implemented by the Department of Justice, Ministry of Law and Justice, GOI. The fund provides financial assistance to states and UTs for setting up Fast Track Special Courts (FTSCs) to deal with cases related to POCSO and other crimes against women. As of May 2024, there are 755 FTSCs in operation across 30 states and UTs, with a total of 2,53,000+ cases disposed of.

ई-कोर्ट मिशन मोड परियोजना के तीसरे चरण का विचार और कार्यान्वयन

यूनिवर्सिटी स्कूल ऑफ लॉ एंड लीगल स्टडीज़, गुरु गोविंद सिंह इंद्रप्रस्थ यूनिवर्सिटी, नई दिल्ली
भारत में पारंपरिक आपराधिक मुकदमे के वैकल्पिक मॉडल के रूप में पली बार्गेनिंग के माध्यम से न्याय तक पहुँच : चुनिंदा भारतीय राज्यों का एक केस अध्ययन
हिमाचल प्रदेश राष्ट्रीय विधि विश्वविद्यालय, शिमला

न्याय तक पहुँच सुनिश्चित करने में निशुल्क वकील (प्रो-बोनो लॉयरिंग) की भूमिका : हिमाचल प्रदेश, हरियाणा, पंजाब, केंद्र शासित प्रदेश चंडीगढ़ और केंद्र शासित प्रदेश जम्मू और कश्मीर के विशेष संदर्भ में एक अध्ययन
दामोदर संजिव्या नेशनल लॉ यूनिवर्सिटी, विशाखापट्टनम, आंध्र प्रदेश
कारोबार करने में सुगमता (ईज़ ऑफ ड्यूइंग बिजनेस) में सुधार के लिए भारत के दक्षिणी क्षेत्र में वाणिज्यिक न्यायालयों के कामकाज पर एक अध्ययन
न्यायाधीशों और अन्य हितधारकों के लिए यात्रा व्यय जैसी लागतों को कम करती है
कभी भी, कहीं से भी अदालती शुल्क, जुर्माना और दंड का भुगतान।
दस्तावेजों को दर्ज करने के लिए आवश्यक समय और प्रयास को कम करने के लिए ई-फाइलिंग का विस्तार, जिससे मानव त्रुटियों को कम किया जा सके
एआई और उसके सबसेट मशीन लर्निंग (एमएल), ऑप्टिकल कैरेक्टर रिकॉग्निशन (ओसीआर), नेचुरल लैंग्वेज प्रोसेसिंग (एनएलपी) जैसी नवीनतम तकनीकों का उपयोग

अदालत की कार्यवाही में सटीकता और बढ़ी हुई पारदर्शिता ।

अदालती प्रक्रियाओं में उभरती प्रौद्योगिकियों का उपयोग उन्हें अधिक कुशल और प्रभावी बना देगा, इसलिए लंबित मामलों की कमी में महत्वपूर्ण योगदान देगा।

इस परियोजना में अधिकारियों की क्षमता निर्माण करना, जिला विधिक सेवा प्राधिकरणों के लिए आईसीटी संबंधी प्रावधान करना, तालुक विधिक सेवा समितियों और राज्य न्यायिक अकादमियों के साथ-साथ न्यायिक प्रक्रिया की पुनः इंजीनियरिंग करना भी शामिल है
चरण-III पर काम शुरू हो गया है, ई-कोर्ट परियोजना चरण-II के लिए विजन दस्तावेज़ की अवधारणा तैयार की गई है और इसे सार्वजनिक डोमेन पर साझा किया गया है,
summary: जिला और अधीनस्थ न्यायालयों में न्यायिक प्रक्रियाओं को अधिक कुशल और त्वरित बनाने के लिए प्रौद्योगिकी का उपयोग करता है। यह परियोजना, न्याय विभाग, विधि और न्याय मंत्रालय, भारत सरकार और ई-समिति, भारत के उच्चतम न्यायालय की संयुक्त भागीदारी के तहत संबंधित उच्च न्यायालयों के माध्यम से विकेंद्रीकृत तरीके से कार्यान्वित की जा रही है। परियोजना के चरण-I को 2010 में अनुमोदित किया गया था और 2015 तक 639 करोड़ रुपए की लागत पर 14,249 जिला और अधीनस्थ न्यायालयों के कंप्यूटरीकरण किया गया था। इस परियोजना का चरण-II को जिसमें और संवर्धन करने का विचार किया गया है, 2015 में चार वर्ष की अवधि के लिए या परियोजना के पूरा होने तक, 1670 करोड़ रुपए के बजट से शुरू किया गया था। दूसरे चरण में वादियों और वकीलों को प्रौद्योगिकी समर्थित बुनियादी ढांचा प्रदान करके न्यायिक सेवा बढ़ाने पर बल दिया गया है।

summary: यह पृष्ठ परिभाषित पद, उच्चतम न्यायालय की क्षेत्रीय खंडपी, परिवार कल्याण समितिया, तेलंगाना उच्च न्यायालय में न्यायाधीशों की रिक्ति, समता न्याय केंद, कानूनी सहायता कार्यक्रम, संघीय न्यायपालिका प्रणाली, न्यायपालिका में भ्रष्टाचार को समाप्त करने की नीति, लोक अदालतों के माध्यम से नि:शुल्क कानूनी सेवाएं, न्यायालयों में लंबित मामले, आंध्र प्रदेश के उच्च न्यायालय की मुख्य सीट का स्थानांतरण, न्याय मित्र, लोक अदालतें, कोर्ट हॉल का निर्माण और न्यायालयों में लंबित मामलों का विश्लेषण पर विभिन्न जानकारी प्रस्तुत करता है।
